My feet hurt. I can't walk quietly anymore.

I'm feeling really down lately. I don't know what to do. I've been praying a lot, but it doesn't seem to be helping.
Every time I try to knock on my neighbor's door, my arthritis pain gets so bad that I can't do it. It's really frustrating.
I'm an old man, and my legs don't work as well as they used to. I sometimes find it hard to walk even short distances without getting tired.

I'm getting too old for this. My trainer is constantly pushing me to do things that are too difficult for me.
I've never been a winner. I don't know what it's like to feel that sense of accomplishment.
The hard stuff just doesn't hit the spot like it used to. I miss the days when I could really enjoy a nice, stiff drink.
The drapes are so thin that the sunlight wakes me up way too early in the morning. I can't stand it.
I've been having trouble disposing of my trash. The city won't pick it up and the dump is too far away.
I'm not sure what's going on, but my antique clock doesn't seem to be working properly. It's been ticking away just fine for years, but now it's stopped and I can't get it started again.
I'm getting old and I don't like it. Everything hurts and I can't do anything anymore.
I can't believe how hard it is to find decent conversation these days. I feel like I'm stuck in a rut, talking to the same people about the same things all the time.

I used to love going for walks in the marshland near my house, but now it's just too hard for me to get around. I miss being able to explore and take in all the sights and sounds of nature.
I'm having a lot of trouble with my vision. I can't see very well, and it's getting worse. I'm afraid I'm going to have to give up driving soon.
I'm getting so old. Every day, I feel more and more like I'm just a burden on society. I can't keep up with the young people anymore, and I feel like I'm just holding everyone back.
